data.title: NGD - 2006 Gibson Les Paul Studio
data.meta_description: Got this LP on Marketplace. I’m technically trying to pare down on guitars but fell for the colour and quickly worked out how to rationalize it to myself...
data.text:
Noodlearms

Strat-Talker

May 27, 2022

269

Canada

May 20, 2024

#1

Got this LP on Marketplace. I’m technically trying to pare down on guitars but fell for the colour and quickly worked out how to rationalize it to myself.

Was a good deal for $450 US, including both original pickups and EMGs, and hardshell case. I really like EMGs in general so will keep them in.

Has a fair amount of wear but I like guitars worn in.

Attachments

Man what a smoking deal! I would buy that right now for that price and I don't even need it. Great looking guitar. HNGD!

#4

$450 - I was sure that was gonna be an Epi ... a Gibson Studio LP could easily sell at twice that

HNGD - great find!

I always thought that was the best colour on LP Studios. Congrats, you got a great deal there

Such Friends

Mar 20, 2024

1,850

Los Angeles

May 20, 2024

#7

im curious if the Les Paul takes away some of the brightness typical of EMGs? i played a Jim Root Jazzmaster that was an enormous beast of a guitar all mahogony and i found it really balanced the tone of its EMGs. usually i dont like their sound in the ESPs ive played with them. As a metalish guitar player, id like to like them so ive tried quite a few out, so again im curious if a beefier guitar like a Les Paul tames them a bit

Noodlearms

Strat-Talker

May 27, 2022

269

Canada

May 20, 2024

#8

im curious if the Les Paul takes away some of the brightness typical of EMGs? i played a Jim Root Jazzmaster that was an enormous beast of a guitar all mahogony and i found it really balanced the tone of its EMGs. usually i dont like their sound in the ESPs ive played with them.

Yeah, I think that’s a really true. I don’t like EMGs as much in ESPs but they sound excellent in Les Pauls. Definitely feels like it trims some of that brightness.

Nice score, That's a heck of a deal!

I paid $500 for this studio from the same time period. Has a chunky neck. Someone used shoe polish or something to try and make it a burst. I bursted the back & neck with nitro and made it gold top with double creams. Dimarzio pups.
